intro: Dorstenia petraea, commonly known as the rock dodder, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its creeping, succulent stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and usually covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Dorstenia petraea is well adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
